org.glassfish.jersey.test
Class JerseyTest

java.lang.Object
  org.glassfish.jersey.test.JerseyTest

public abstract class JerseyTest
extends Object

Parent class for all tests written using Jersey test framework.

Author:
Paul Sandoz (paul.sandoz at oracle.com), Srinivas Bhimisetty, Pavel Bucek (pavel.bucek at oracle.com), Michal Gajdos (michal.gajdos at oracle.com)

Constructor Detail

JerseyTest

public JerseyTest()
           throws TestContainerException
An extending class must implement the configure() method to provide an application descriptor.

Throws:
TestContainerException - if the default test container factory cannot be obtained, or the application descriptor is not supported by the test container factory.

JerseyTest

public JerseyTest(TestContainerFactory testContainerFactory)
Construct a new instance with a test container factory.

An extending class must implement the configure() method to provide an application descriptor.

Parameters:
testContainerFactory - the test container factory to use for testing.
Throws:
TestContainerException - if the application descriptor is not supported by the test container factory.

JerseyTest

public JerseyTest(Application jaxrsApplication)
           throws TestContainerException
Construct a new instance with an application descriptor that defines how the test container is configured.

Parameters:
jaxrsApplication - an application describing how to configure the test container.
Throws:
TestContainerException - if the default test container factory cannot be obtained, or the application descriptor is not supported by the test container factory.

JerseyTest

public JerseyTest(Class<? extends Application> jaxrsApplicationClass)
           throws TestContainerException
Construct a new instance with an Application class.

Parameters:
jaxrsApplicationClass - an application describing how to configure the test container.
Throws:
TestContainerException - if the default test container factory cannot be obtained, or the application descriptor is not supported by the test container factory.
Method Detail

enable

protected final void enable(String featureName)
Programmatically enable a feature with a given name. Enabling of the feature may be overridden via a system property.

Parameters:
featureName - name of the enabled feature.

disable

protected final void disable(String featureName)
Programmatically disable a feature with a given name. Disabling of the feature may be overridden via a system property.

Parameters:
featureName - name of the disabled feature.

forceEnable

protected final void forceEnable(String featureName)
Programmatically force-enable a feature with a given name. Force-enabling of the feature cannot be overridden via a system property. Use with care!

Parameters:
featureName - name of the force-enabled feature.

forceDisable

protected final void forceDisable(String featureName)
Programmatically force-disable a feature with a given name. Force-disabling of the feature cannot be overridden via a system property. Use with care!

Parameters:
featureName - name of the force-disabled feature.

propertyName - name of the property.
value - property value.

forceSet

protected final void forceSet(String propertyName,
                              String value)
Programmatically force-set a value of a property with a given name. The force-set property value cannot be overridden via a system property.

Parameters:
propertyName - name of the property.
value - property value.

isEnabled

protected boolean isEnabled(String featureName)

configure

protected Application configure()
Return an JAX-RS application that defines how the application in the test container is configured.

If a constructor is utilized that does not supply an application descriptor then this method must be overridden to return an application descriptor, otherwise an UnsupportedOperationException exception will be thrown.

If a constructor is utilized that does supply an application descriptor then this method does not require to be overridden and will not be invoked.

Returns:
the application descriptor.

setTestContainerFactory

protected final void setTestContainerFactory(TestContainerFactory testContainerFactory)
Sets the test container factory to to be used for testing.

Parameters:
testContainerFactory - the test container factory to to be used for testing.

getTestContainerFactory

protected TestContainerFactory getTestContainerFactory()
                                                throws TestContainerException
Returns an instance of TestContainerFactory class. This instance can be set by a constructor (JerseyTest(org.glassfish.jersey.test.spi.TestContainerFactory), as an application Provider or the TestContainerFactory class can be set as a "jersey.config.test.container.factory" property.

Returns:
an instance of TestContainerFactory class.
Throws:
TestContainerException - if the initialization of TestContainerFactory instance is not successful.

target

public WebTarget target()
Create a web resource whose URI refers to the base URI the Web application is deployed at.

Returns:
the created web resource

target

public WebTarget target(String path)
Create a web resource whose URI refers to the base URI the Web application is deployed at plus the path specified in the argument.

This method is an equivalent of calling target().path(path).

Parameters:
path - Relative path (from base URI) this target should point to.
Returns:
the created web resource

client

public Client client()
Get the client that is configured for this test.

Returns:
the configured client.

setUp

public void setUp()
           throws Exception
Set up the test by invoking TestContainer.start() on the test container obtained from the test container factory.

Throws:
Exception - if an exception is thrown during setting up the test environment.

tearDown

public void tearDown()
              throws Exception
Tear down the test by invoking TestContainer.stop() on the test container obtained from the test container factory.

Throws:
Exception - if an exception is thrown during tearing down the test environment.

getClient

protected Client getClient(TestContainer tc,
                           ApplicationHandler applicationHandler)
Creates an instance of Client.

Checks whether TestContainer provides ClientConfig instance and if not, empty new ClientConfig instance will be used to create new client instance.

This method is called exactly once when JerseyTest is created.

Parameters:
tc - instance of TestContainer
applicationHandler - instance of ApplicationHandler
Returns:
A Client instance.

configureClient

protected void configureClient(ClientConfig clientConfig)
Can be overridden by subclasses to conveniently configure the client instance used by the test.

Parameters:
clientConfig - Client configuration that can be modified to configure the client.

getBaseUri

protected URI getBaseUri()
Returns the base URI of the application.

Returns:
The base URI of the application

getPort

protected final int getPort()
Get the port to be used for test application deployments.

Returns:
The HTTP port of the URI

getLoggedRecords

protected List<LogRecord> getLoggedRecords()
Get stored log records if enabled by setting TestProperties.RECORD_LOG_LEVEL or an empty list.

Returns:
list of log records or an empty list.

getLastLoggedRecord

protected LogRecord getLastLoggedRecord()
Get last stored log record if enabled by setting TestProperties.RECORD_LOG_LEVEL or null.

Returns:
last stored log record or null.
